structure.unit: STATE AND FEDERAL HIGHWAYS -- LIMITED ACCESS FACILITIES -- TURNPIKES -- ROAD BONDS -- BILLBOARDS -- RECYCLERS

text.section: Except as otherwise provided in KRS 177.830 to 177.890, the erection or maintenance of any advertising device upon or within six hundred sixty (660) feet of the right-of-way of any interstate highway or federal-aid primary highway is prohibited.

The erection or maintenance of any advertising device located outside of an urban area and beyond six hundred sixty (660) feet of the right-of-way which is legible and/or identifiable from the main traveled way of any interstate highway or federal-aid primary highway is prohibited with the exception of:
Directional and official signs and notices;
Signs advertising the sale or lease of property upon which they are located; or
Signs advertising activities conducted on the property on which they are located.

law.history: Created 1976 Ky. Acts ch. 80, sec. 3, effective March 29, 1976.
